p: Previous studies report that 4-hydroxycinnamic acid ( p-coumaric acid) is derived from cinnamic acid via the P450-dependent enzyme 4-cinnamic acid hydroxylase [ 46]. It has been primarily found in the fruits of M. alba at lower levels than other compounds [ 47, 48], but this study indicates that the twigs of M. alba may be another key accumulation part for 4-hydroxycinnamic acid, as previously reported [ 49].
